Definition: The process of designing and writing instructions for a computer to execute
The creation and maintenance of software applications
A sequence of courses and experiences preparing students for programming careers
A professional who writes and tests code for software applications
A professional who designs, develops, and maintains software systems
Creations of the mind, such as code, protected by law
A legal right protecting original works, including software, from unauthorized use
Software with source code freely available for modification and distribution
Moral principles guiding responsible behavior in programming
A legal agreement defining how software can be used or distributed
A classification of data, such as integer or string, determining its operations
A whole number data type without decimal points
A data type representing numbers with decimal points
A sequence of characters, such as text, used in programming
A data structure storing multiple values of the same type in a single variable
A data structure allowing ordered storage of elements, often dynamic in size
A data structure grouping related data fields, like a database row
An array of arrays, used to represent matrices or grids
A file storing data in a continuous sequence, read or written in order
A named storage location in memory holding a value
A reusable block of code performing a specific task
A variable passed to a function to customize its behavior
The output a function sends back to the calling code
Dividing a program into independent, reusable modules or functions
A programming paradigm using objects and classes
A blueprint defining properties and behaviors of objects
An instance of a class containing data and methods
A function or procedure defined within a class
Hiding an object’s internal data and exposing only necessary interfaces
A mechanism where a class derives properties from another class
The ability of different classes to be treated as instances of a common class
The process of planning, designing, coding, testing, and maintaining software
A step-by-step procedure to solve a problem
A high-level description of a program’s logic, not in a specific programming language
A visual diagram representing a program’s logic or workflow
The process of identifying and fixing errors in code
A mistake in the code’s structure that prevents it from running
A flaw in the program’s logic causing incorrect results
An error occurring during program execution, often due to invalid operations
A specific input and expected output used to verify program correctness
Testing individual components or functions of a program
A system to track and manage changes to code, like Git
Integrated Development Environment, a tool combining code editing, debugging, and testing
Non-executable text in code used to explain its purpose or logic
Written information explaining how to use or maintain software
A collection of programming projects showcasing skills and experience
The process of examining code to ensure quality and correctness
Working with others to develop software or solve programming problems
A document summarizing skills, education, and experience for job applications
Having the skills and knowledge needed for a programming career
A methodology using iterative cycles to develop software
